text: Hey <@UFYK1C90C>! Your templates in HubSpot can be html files, however, there are many changes you would want to make to them to make sure they work correctly in HubSpot and with the Content Editors
Some information on the HubSpot templating language, HubL, can be found here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/syntax>
I would recommend that your content be part of modules: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/getting-started>

Howdy devs!

The support for more file types in the Design Manager (like images and font files) and editing of Global Content for global coded template partials in the content editor that Gregory and I talked about at Developer Day is ready for beta usage! :partyparrot: :hamsterdance:

More details on how to be part of this beta can be found here: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kxWmqd3Jl9gTu7jGd86npf6fS0Hw5C5riUjgaE0SV4c/edit?usp=sharing>.

Please feel free to share any and all feedback in relevant slack channels or DMs!

Also, make sure and join <#CMXUWUY5D|hs-cms-boilerplate> for discussion or questions on the HubSpot CMS  Boilerplate <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate> which utilizes the above concepts
